---
title: Tension Type Headache
---

# Epidemiology

Women > men

# Clinical Presentation

- Typically bilateral
    - muscles of the head
    - Periorbital, temporal and occipital


- May occur daily for several hours a day
- Chronic potentially in nature

Precipitating factors:

- Stress
- Tension


Onset:

- Usually u dont wake up w this
- Builds over the course of the day
- No warning signs


## Symptoms

Quality:

- Dull ache, tight band, heavy weight on head
- Mod to severe

Associated symptoms:


# Treatment

## Physical therapy


- Trigger point release
- STM/MFR
- Upper C/S HVLAT or mobs
- Diaphragmatic breathing
- Stretching
- Strengthening
- Pt education
